reason: Powerful personal anecdote setting the stage for the discussion on consciousness,  highly engaging and relatable.
Shift in perspective from physicalism to a deeper understanding of consciousness. Strong opinion and impactful transition.
Explains the core concept of the new theory concisely and powerfully; uses strong statements and rhetorical questions.
Introduces the concept of holism in biology using epigenetics as an example.  Illustrates a complex idea clearly.
Sharp comparison between the function of a cell and a computer, highlighting the limitations of classical models.
Explains the concept of quantum decoherence and its implications for classical computing versus quantum systems.
Strong argument for Free Will and consciousness as foundational postulates, challenging conventional scientific viewpoints.
Clearly defines the fundamental difference between quantum and classical physics, focusing on indeterminacy.
Reinforces the self-evident nature of free will and consciousness as starting points for the theory.
Highlights the limitations of current scientific understanding in addressing the nature of consciousness and free will.
